intro: Achillea kermanica, commonly known as Persian yarrow, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring dark green, feathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to spread and form dense colonies in well-drained soils. Achillea kermanica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine.
